text: Yes they are! They're really useful. My main suggestion would be, that if you want to show off what you've learnt, is to adapt them in some way. A lot of people will just post an exact replica of the tutorial, which is great, but on a showreel, everyone just knows it. Maybe try a different shaped building, or multiple buildings at once. Some way to show you've learnt it and can apply it in a different context is great!

<https://www.linkedin.com/posts/pierre-burgoni-241a85119_hi-here-is-my-latest-personnal-project-ugcPost-6579757245700022272-69Ro>

Noticed your saw this too the other day. A brilliant concept of just putting them all together in one scene

attachments.title: Pierre Burgoni on LinkedIn: "Hi !  Here is my latest personnal project using houdini 17.5. Rendered with mantra. Inspired by a fantastic lesson from Steven Knipping called Applied Houdini Rigids III. The helicopter asset is from the lesson.  Hope you'll like !  "
